info.title: Freestyle Sandboxes
info.description:
Freestyle Sandboxes lets you deploy your users or AIs code. **Get your API Key at [admin.freestyle.sh](https://admin.freestyle.sh)**

They are broken up into 4 categories: [Web](#tag/web), [Execute](#tag/execute), [Cloudstate](#tag/cloudstate), and [Domains](#tag/domains).

[Web](#tag/web): Send us the code for the website, we'll provision the certificates and get it hosted

[Execute](#tag/execute): Send us a function, we'll run it and send you the output

[Cloudstate](#tag/cloudstate): Our Opensource JavaScript Runtime used for cloud functions with persistent state

[Domains](#tag/domains): Manage your domains, including verification and listing

get.description: Get a backup of a cloudstate project

post.description:
Provisions a wildcard certificate for a verified domain


This speeds up deploys on all subdomains of the domain. In order to use it, you must add the following record to your DNS config:

`_acme-challenge.yourdomain.com` NS `dns.freestyle.sh`

x-codeSamples.label: Human SDK

get.description: This lists the domains that an account has verified ownership of. This includes the *.style.dev domains the account has claimed.

x-codeSamples.label: Human SDK

get.summary: List domain verification requests for an account
get.description: Lists domain verification requests for the current account.

x-codeSamples.label: Human SDK

put.description: This checks a pre-existing verification request for a domain. To create a verification request, call the [create domain verification](/#tag/domains/POST/domains/v1/verifications) endpoint. This endpoint will check if the domain has a TXT record with the verification code. If it does, the domain will be verified.

x-codeSamples.label: Human SDK

post.description: This creates a Freestyle Domain Verification Request. It returns a `verificationCode` for your domain. You need to place this code in a TXT record at `_freestyle_custom_hostname.thedomain.com`, then call the [verify domain](/#tag/domains/PUT/domains/v1/verifications) endpoint with the domain to verify it.

x-codeSamples.label: Human SDK

delete.description: This deletes a Freestyle Domain Verification Request. This does not remove the domain from the account if it has already been verified, however the verification code will no longer be valid.

x-codeSamples.label: Human SDK
Human SDK

post.description: Send a TypeScript or JavaScript module, get the result

x-codeSamples.label: Human SDK

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of repositories to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset for the list of repositories

post.description:
Create a repository. Once the repository is created, it will also be created on the Git server.
The repository name must be unique within your account.

Once created, you can then push your code to this repository.

The repo will be available at `git.freestyle.sh/{repo-id}`

delete.description: Delete a repository. This is irreversible, and will also delete the repository on the Git server.

403.description: User does not have permission to delete this repository

get.description: Get the logs for a deployment

x-codeSamples.label: Human SDK

post.description: Deploy a website. Files is a map of file paths to file contents. Configuration is optional and contains additional information about the deployment.

x-codeSamples.label: Human SDK

get.description: Get information about a web deploy by its ID.

domains.description: ID of the project to deploy, if not provided will create a new project

envVars.description: The environment variables that the cloudstate deploy can access

domain.description: The domain to create a verification code for

entrypoint.description: The entrypoint file for the website

domains.description: The custom domains for the website, eg. [\"subdomain.yourwebsite.com\"]. You may include a single *.style.dev domain here.

projectId.description: Project ID was our original way of tracking deployments together, it is now deprecated and will be removed in the future. Please use the domains field to specify the domains for your project.

nodeModules.description: Node Modules to install for the website, a map of package names to versions, e.g. { \"express\": \"4.17.1\" }. If this and a package-lock.json are provided, the package-lock.json, bun.lockb, pnpm-lock.yaml, or yarn.lock is also provided, the versions here will override the versions in those lock files.

envVars.description:
The environment variables that the website can access
e.g. { \"RESEND_API_KEY\": \"re_123456789\" }

files.description:
The files to deploy, a map of file paths to file contents, e.g. { \"index.js\": {\"content\": \"your main\", \"encoding\": \"utf-8\"}, \"file2.js\": {\"content\": \"your helper\" } }

**Do not include node modules in this bundle, they will not work**. Instead, includes a package-lock.json, bun.lockb, pnpm-lock.yaml, or yarn.lock, the node modules for the project will be installed from that lock file, or use the node_modules field in the configuration to specify the node modules to install.

domain.description: The domain to create a verification code for

script.description: The JavaScript or TypeScript script to execute

envVars.description: The environment variables to set for the script

nodeModules.description: The node modules to install for the script

tags.description: Tags for you to organize your scripts, useful for tracking what you're running

peerDependencyResolution.description: If false, we'll not resolve peer dependencies for the packages given, this can speed up execute performance, but will break packages with peers unless the peers are manually specified.

encoding.description: The encoding of the file. Either **utf-8** or **base64**

tags.name: Web
tags.description: APIs for deploying websites. We handle node modules caching, scaling, certificates and the whole end to end process. Send the code using the [deploy](#tag/web/POST/web/v1/deploy) endpoint, and you'll get a full hosted website back. Works with any TypeScript or JavaScript codebase.

tags.name: Execute
tags.description: APIs for running code. Send the code using the [execute](#tag/execute/POST/execute/v1/execute) endpoint, and you'll get the output back. Works with any TypeScript or JavaScript code + handles any node modules and environment variables you want.

tags.name: Cloudstate
tags.description: APIs for running cloud functions with persistent state. [Cloudstate](https://github.com/freestyle-sh/cloudstate/) is an opensource, durable JavaScript runtime maintained by the Freestyle Team.

tags.name: Domains
tags.description:
APIs for managing domains. This is only relevant when you want to start to deploy to custom domains. 
Please read [this guide](https://github.com/freestyle-sh/sandbox_sdks/blob/main/docs/custom_domains.md) to understand how deployments work with custom domains.
